title.rendered: 10 Best WordPress Courses to Take in 2023

content.rendered:
That’s right. Your web presence is very important today if you want to reach a lot of people, no matter your purpose. Be it a blog or an e-commerce store, your website needs to be attractive as well as rank high on search engines. WordPress online courses are a good starting point to learn exactly what you need in order to satisfy both.

Even though WordPress doesn’t necessarily require you to be equipped with HTML, CSS or JavaScript skills, you can read my Web Development guide if you want to learn coding for the web.

In this guide, I’ve selected the 10 best free and paid WordPress online courses for you from the 600+ WordPress courses on our catalog by following a well-defined methodology that you can find below.

But if you want to jump straight to the results, here are my top 10 picks. You can click on a course to jump to the corresponding section:

Course Workload In Brief
1. WordPress for Beginners: Create a Website Step by Step (Udemy) 4-5 hours Best WordPress course for beginners, practical, step-by-step walkthrough
2. WordPress for Beginners – Master WordPress Quickly (Udemy) 9 hours Great WordPress course for anyone, focuses on building an affiliate website
3. How To Make a Website With WordPress (freeCodeCamp) 1-2 hours Best free course for learning WordPress from the experts of a non-profit
4. Build an E-Commerce Website using WordPress (Website Learners) 3-4 hours E-commerce focused free WordPress course, great for Indian learners
5. Build a Website from Start to Finish using WordPress (freeCodeCamp) 5 hours Free course for learning WordPress and Elementor along with coding in HTML and CSS
6. WordPress Essential Training (LinkedIn Learning) 1-2 hours Short WordPress training, includes tips and tricks, free trial available
7. Free WordPress training: WordPress for beginners (Yoast) 14-18 hours Extensive WordPress training from SEO experts, comes with a free certificate
8. How To Make a WordPress Website (Tyler Moore) 1-2 hours Short free course for learning WordPress with an enthusiastic instructor
9. WordPress – How To Videos (Create WP Site) 8 hours Free WordPress tutorials and how-to videos for building websites more efficiently
10. Building a Small Business Website with WordPress (LinkedIn Learning) 1-2 hours Good short course for learning WordPress, focuses on creating a business blog

What is WordPress?

WordPress is the world’s most popular website builder. 43% of the web is built on WordPress. More technically, WordPress is a free and open-source content management system. WordPress is powered by PHP. Here’s our PHP Skill Guide if you’re interested in PHP courses.

Free and open-source software (FOSS) means anyone can install, use, and modify that software for free. Content management system (CMS) is a tool used to manage the creation and modification of digital content – in our case, that of a website.

WordPress is also popular for being fully customizable and you can even install themes and plugins. For example, with Elementor, a website builder, you can create content in blocks without worrying about coding, or if you want to build a store, you can install WooCommerce.

Why are WordPress Skills Important?

The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics predicts that there will be a 13 percent increase in web development job opportunities from 2020 to 2030, faster than the average growth rate for all occupations.

At the moment, there are over 8,000 jobs for WordPress Developers available on Upwork and the average salary for this position is of USD 67K a year in the US according to Glassdoor.

Even if you don’t want to become a developer, learning the basics of WordPress might help you with an online project, share your portfolio or resume online, or just have some fun blogging in your free time.

What is My Experience with WordPress?

The guide you’re currently reading is powered by WordPress. So you can understand how important it is for our Class Central team to know how to use WordPress. Even though I’m still a beginner at it, I often come to WordPress to make edits and updates to our articles. This guide is going to be of help for me too!

Besides that, I am a Guided Project Instructor and a Beta Tester at Coursera, having tested many courses before they’re officially launched. I have taken over 50 online courses in various subjects.

My experience as an online learner and teacher has given me some perspective on what to look for in an online course. I used my experience to evaluate each course in this list.

Course Ranking Methodology

I built this ranking following the now tried-and-tested methodology I used in previous rankings (you can find them all here). It involves a three-step process:

  1. Research: I started by leveraging Class Central’s database with 100K online courses and 200K+ reviews. Then, I made a preliminary selection of 600+ WordPress courses by rating, reviews, and bookmarks.
  2. Evaluate: I read through reviews on Class Central, Reddit, and course providers to understand what other learners thought about each course and combined it with my own experience as a learner.
  3. Select: Well-made courses were picked if they presented valuable and engaging content and they have to fit in a set of criteria and be ranked accordingly: comprehensive curriculum, release date, affordability, ratings and enrollments.

The end result is a unique selection of courses that combines a decade of Class Central data and my own experience as an online learner to try to get the best of both worlds. So far, I’ve spent more than 15 hours building this list, and I’ll continue to update it.

Course Ranking Statistics

Here are some statistics regarding this course ranking:

  • Combined, these courses have accrued over 116K enrollments.
  • 6 courses are free or free-to-audit and 4 courses are paid.
  • The most-represented course provider in the ranking is YouTube, with 5 courses.
  • All 10 courses are in English.
  • The WordPress subject is followed by over 8.8K learners on Class Central, and accounts for over 600 courses in Class Central catalog.

So without further ado, let’s get to my picks for the best WordPress online courses.

1. WordPress for Beginners: Create a Website Step by Step (Udemy)

My first pick for the best WordPress online course is WordPress for Beginners: Create a Website Step by Step on Udemy.

Whether you want to create websites and blogs without coding, or update existing websites, this course will take you step by step through the process. You’ll be able to work alongside the instructor and, by the end of this course, take a vocabulary of WordPress with you so that you can continue to learn independently.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll learn what WordPress is, how to set up a new WordPress site, create pages, create blog posts, customize the colors & theme of your website, embed YouTube videos into your website, and set up custom navigation menus, create photo galleries, and invite multiple authors into your WordPress.

You’ll also understand what plugin and widget are, let visitors of your blog posts comment via their social media accounts, configure an interactive contact us page, guard yourselves from comment and contact-form spam, and use a custom homepage instead of a generic blog listing.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 10 sections. Each section involves about 20 to 40 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and readings.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Brad Schiff
Level Beginner
Workload 4-5 hours
Enrollments 19.4K
Rating 4.7/5.0 (4.5K)
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Schiff is a front-end developer, designer, and educator.
  • He builds user interfaces for the world’s largest brands, international technology leaders, and national political campaigns.
  • He runs a popular YouTube channel, LearnWebCode, where he teaches Web development, JavaScript and WordPress.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

2. WordPress for Beginners – Master WordPress Quickly (Udemy)

My second pick for the best WordPress online course is WordPress for Beginners – Master WordPress Quickly on Udemy.

Aimed towards complete beginners, and anyone in general, you’ll watch over the instructor’s shoulders as he builds an affiliate website in WordPress (that will provide a passive income). You’ll primarily use WordPress on your own computer for completing this course before putting it online.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll learn how to Install WordPress on your PC or Mac, build a functional and responsive website with WordPress, navigate around the WordPress dashboard, understand the main features of WordPress, create pages and posts and know the difference between the two, and create custom menus and navigation systems.

You’ll also learn how to use post categories and tags, know how to configure WordPress, understand plugins and themes and how to install them, protect your WordPress website from hackers and spammers, create a static homepage and a blog-like homepage, and create a responsive website that suits any browser.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 20 sections. Each section involves about 15 minutes to 1 hour of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and quizzes.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Andrew Williams
Level Beginner
Workload 9 hours
Enrollments 104K
Rating 4.6/5.0 (24.7K)
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • This course is a bestseller on Udemy.
  • Williams has written and published a number of books available on Amazon such as WordPress for Beginners 2022 and SEO 2021.
  • He used to be a school teacher and attributes his didactic to that experience.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

3. How To Make a Website With WordPress (freeCodeCamp.org)

My third pick for the best WordPress online course is the free course, How To Make a Website With WordPress, offered by freeCodeCamp.org on YouTube.

Learn from the experts as the instructor takes you through the process of getting a domain name and hosting, installing WordPress  to using a theme, so that you can customize your website exactly the way you want. You don’t need to know any coding in order to take this course. And it’s completely free!

What You’ll Learn

You’ll begin the course by understanding what WordPress is. You’ll get a domain name and hosting from Hostinger, understand the hosting dashboard, install WordPress, log into WordPress admin dashboard, and uninstall default plugins.

Next, you’ll get an overview of the WordPress dashboard, update WordPress, add and modify users, update Permalinks, install a WordPress theme, install plugins, install a demo template, back up WordPress website, and begin customizing the website.

You’ll move on to creating a custom logo, updating website general colors, adding a favicon, editing website content, adding custom elements with Elementor, editing text on website, updating links, changing colors of individual elements, and adding pictures.

After that, you’ll update layout and look, add new sections to pages, update pages and menus, create new pages, set homepage to be a blog, update blog entries page, create new blog post, edit blog post display settings, and remove sample articles.

Finally, you’ll end the course by learning how to turn off comments, edit the contact page, add custom contact form, and update website header, social links, website footer, custom CSS and scroll to the top button.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 45 videos. Each video involves about 1 to 2 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Channel freeCodeCamp.org
Provider YouTube
Instructor Beau Carnes
Level Beginner
Workload 1-2 hours
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Carnes is a teacher and a developer who also runs the freeCodeCamp YouTube channel.
  • There are over 150 courses available on our catalog from freeCodeCamp.
  • Here’s a great course for beginners for learning theme development in WordPress.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

4. Build an E-Commerce Website using WordPress (Website Learners)

My fourth pick for the best WordPress online course is the free course, Build an E-Commerce Website using WordPress, offered by Website Learners on YouTube.

Want to build an e-commerce website but don’t know where to start? In this quick-start guide, you’ll learn not only how to create a website in WordPress but also how to add important commerce features such as payment methods and SMS gateways. This free course is especially useful for Indian learners.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll learn how to make an e-commerce website, add cash-on-delivery payment method in WordPress, add a variable product to your ecommerce website, add pin code checker to your e-commerce website, and generate invoices on your e-commerce website, and add PayPal payment gateway in WordPress.

Then, you’ll sell digital products on WordPress, add social login to WordPress, add coupon codes in WordPress, create a business email and use it with Gmail, install Google Analytics in WordPress, rank your website on Google, and integrate SMS gateway in your Website.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 14 videos. Each video involves about 10 to 20 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Channel Website Learners
Provider YouTube
Instructor Bryan and Shyam
Level Beginner
Workload 3-4 hours
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Website Learners is a team of 50+ based in Chennai, India.
  • They also have tons of free and paid resources available on their website.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

5. Build a Website from Start to Finish using WordPress (freeCodeCamp.org)

My fifth pick for the best WordPress online course is the free course, Build a Website from Start to Finish using WordPress, offered by freeCodeCamp.org on YouTube.

For all you coders out there, the wait is finally over. Here’s another WordPress course from fCC, but this time, you’ll get the opportunity to apply your web development skills, specifically HTML and CSS. You’ll build a completely custom website using WordPress, PHP, HTML, CSS and Elementor. And it’s completely free!

What You’ll Learn

First, you’ll design your website, set up your local server, create your WordPress database, download and install WordPress, install Elementor and theme plugins, create your theme files, use functions.php to set up your theme defaults, and create default theme pages.

Next, you’ll install your theme, perform general setup, create header and footer blocks, your home page, custom post type and meta boxes and shortcodes using your CPTs, modify columns for your CPTs, and create your menus and additional pages.

After that, you’ll create single pages for your CPTs, create a form, create elementor section templates, create another CPT, validate and modify mobile, export your website for production, recommend security, SEO and cache plugins, and set up security, caching and SEO.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 19 videos. Each video involves about 15 to 30 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Channel freeCodeCamp.org
Provider YouTube
Instructor Erik
Level Intermediate
Workload 5 hours
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Here’s a great course for beginners (involves basic coding) for learning theme development in WordPress.
  • Erik has his own YouTube channel, DevDrawer, with more tutorials on WordPress, WebDev, PHP, App development, and much more.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

6. WordPress Essential Training (LinkedIn Learning)

My sixth pick for the best WordPress online course is WordPress Essential Training on LinkedIn Learning.

This is one of the shortest courses on this list. In this course, you’ll use WordPress 6.0 to launch, customize, and manage a self-hosted website. You’ll not only learn how to create your own website using WordPress, but will also get useful tips and tricks from the instructor.

What You’ll Learn

First, you’ll learn what WordPress is. You’ll learn about the open-source philosophy, what is new in 5.9 and 6.0, the difference between .com and .org, and the WordPress community.

Then, you’ll learn to  set up WordPress. You’ll choose a WordPress host, launch a WordPress site, create user accounts and log in, and update WordPress core. You’ll also navigate the main menu, the dashboard homepage and the top bar.

Next, you’ll customize site settings. You’ll navigate the settings menu, choose and manage themes, set colors and fonts, and install your logo. You’ll also create a widget, a menu and a footer, and manage widgets.

You’ll then learn to create a new page and manage pages. You’ll create a new post, manage posts, use categories and tags, and add a featured image.You’ll also add a new block, customize blocks, and use the blocks sidebar.

You’ll also learn to use reusable blocks and  advanced Gutenberg features, add new media files, manage media files, find and install WordPress plugins, manage plugins, create secure user accounts, install an SSL certificate, take WordPress backups, and ensure long-term WordPress security.

Finally, you’ll understand troubleshooting. You’ll take a look at errors such as white screen of death, theme has stopped working, site has been hacked, and work on site health and troubleshooting.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 12 modules. Each module involves about 5 to 15 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor Allie Nimmons
Level Beginner
Workload 1-2 hours
Enrollments 5.7K
Rating 4.7/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Nimmons is an Austin-based, self-taught WordPress content creator and instructor.
  • Check out Allie’s awesome portfolio on beediaproductions.com.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

7. Free WordPress training: WordPress for beginners (Yoast)

My seventh pick for the best WordPress online course is the free course, Free WordPress training: WordPress for beginners on YouTube.

Whether you want to create your own personal blog, an online store, or a business website, this WordPress course makes it very simple. The most extensive course on this list, it doesn’t only teach you WordPress, you’ll even get a free certificate upon completion!

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you’ll learn what WordPress is, what the difference between WordPress.com and WordPress.org is, what you can do with WordPress, and what open source means.

In the second module, you’ll learn how to choose a hosting company, get your own domain, become familiar with the WordPress back end, and find out how you want to use WordPress.

In the third module, you’ll learn how to customize your site, use WordPress settings, themes, plugins and widgets, and understand the basics of page builders.

In the fourth module, you’ll explore how to add posts and pages to your WordPress site, and add images and videos to these posts and pages by adding.

In the fifth module, you’ll learn how to organize your content with menus, categories and tags so that people can find what they need on your site.

In the sixth module, you’ll learn how to manage your WordPress site with user roles, updates, and backups after you’ve set it up.

In the seventh module, you’ll learn what WordPress does for your site’s SEO, how the Yoast SEO plugin can help you, and what you should do yourself.

Finally, in the eighth module, you’ll learn about the history of WordPress, its open-source ecosystem, and how you can contribute.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 8 modules. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and quizzes.

Institution Yoast
Instructor Joost, Marieke, Fleur, Jesse, Maartje, Remkus, Dijana, Michiel and Siobhan
Level Beginner
Workload 14-18 hours
Certificate Free

Fun Facts

  • Yoast is the most popular search engine optimization (SEO) plugin for WordPress.
  • Their team publishes lots of content on SEO and much more.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

8. How To Make a WordPress Website (Tyler Moore)

My eighth pick for the best WordPress online course is the free course, How To Make a WordPress Website, offered by Tyler Moore on YouTube.

Here’s another short but completely free WordPress course for beginners. Accompanied by a fun and enthusiastic instructor, you’ll learn every step in the process of building your own website. No matter what your need is, you’ll be able to make the exact website that you want, and even take inspiration from renowned brands.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll learn how to make any design in WordPress, get an overview of the setup, understand domain name and hosting, get big hosting discount, install WordPress, log in and see the dashboard, delete plugins, posts and pages, and choose your design, and change title and tagline.

Next, you’ll take a look at homepage design, text, buttons, undo/redo, sections, images, backgrounds, spacing, about page, video, services page, icons, responsiveness, contact page, add Google Map, contact form, add new page, import a page, and import a block.

Finally, you’ll learn about the transparent header, copy a design, design from scratch, add pages to the menu, make logo and site icon, insert logo and edit header, insert site icon, edit footer, and create the final design.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 19 videos. Each video involves about 1 to 3 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Channel Tyler Moore
Provider YouTube
Instructor Tyler Moore
Level Beginner
Workload 1-2 hours
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Moore has put together the perfect guide to help you build your WordPress website.
  • He also made available free CSS templates to fully customize your website.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

9. WordPress – How To Videos (Create WP Site)

My ninth pick for the best WordPress online course is the free course, WordPress – How To Videos, offered by Create WP Site on YouTube.

This course is actually a compilation of several tutorials teaching different aspects of WordPress. It’s more of a playlist of how-to videos (as the name suggests) so that you can learn how to build your own website with WordPress quickly and easily.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll install GoDaddy WordPress, install WordPress, create a blog on WordPress, build a website with Bluehost, add menu tabs to your WordPress website, embed a YouTube video on WordPress, and link a button to a page.

You’ll also duplicate a page In WordPress, add WordPress plugins to your website, add a custom link to your WordPress menu, create a dropdown menu In WordPress, write your first WordPress blog post, change background color, add categories In WordPress, and change logo in header.

Finally, you’ll use the WordPress sidebar, install a WordPress theme, wrap text around an image, add widget to page, add video to a page or post, schedule a post, change the WordPress site title, and delete themes.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 15 videos. Each video involves about 30 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Channel Create WP Site
Provider YouTube
Level Beginner
Workload 8 hours
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Create WP Site has also a website with tutorials and articles.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

10. Building a Small Business Website with WordPress (LinkedIn Learning)

My tenth pick for the best WordPress online course is Building a Small Business Website with WordPress on LinkedIn Learning.

From site planning to customizing your website, this course will walk you through each step of the process of building your website using WordPress. You’ll learn how to create your own blog, complete with a contact form and calls-to-action. Plus, you’ll also get useful tips and tricks to work more efficiently.

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you’ll prepare to build your site. You’ll learn about establishing site purpose and goals, identifying site requirements, making a basic content inventory, tips for writing copy, tips for sourcing images, and working with images.

In the second module, you’ll explore configuring site appearance. You’ll get an overview of full site editing, and learn about finding a theme that meets your needs, installing and activating Astra, exploring customization options, using starter templates, setting up the front page, customizing the theme and customizing the site using widgets/blocks.

In the third module, you’ll extend functionality with plugins. You’ll understand the plugin landscape, find plugins that meet your needs, and get a roundup of plugins for this course.

In the fourth module, you’ll add key content to your website. You’ll learn about posts vs. pages, create an about page, create a contact page, create a blog or news page, and add a custom menu.

In the fifth module, you’ll cover advanced topics in website ownership. You’ll learn how to show up in search engines, and understand the cost of ownership.

Finally, in the sixth module, you’ll go live. You’ll review site specifications, test the site before going live, secure your site and manage spam, and ensure ongoing site maintenance and health.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 6 modules. Each module involves about 10 to 20 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and practice exercises.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor Carrie Dils
Level Intermediate
Workload 1-2 hours
Enrollments 1.5K
Rating 4.8/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Dils has been helping businesses craft online identities since 1998.
  • She blogs regularly about WordPress and the business of freelancing at carriedils.com.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

excerpt.rendered: Whether you want to sell cookies or tell your travel stories, a WordPress website will get you ahead of the crowd.
